message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.CL, cs.CV. 

The paper deals with the concept of clustering, which is a fundamental topic in machine learning and data science. The use of $k$-means algorithm and the focus on the simplicity of clustering suggest that the paper belongs to the sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG). However, the paper also discusses the common sense aspect of clustering, which indicates that it could be relevant to Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) as well. The notion of a well-clusterable data set is related to the quality of the data and its distribution, which falls under the sub-category of Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS). The paper also mentions the use of clustering in natural language processing and computer vision, which suggests that it could be relevant to Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) and Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV) sub-categories.
